rioko.searchers

Class BreadthSearchIterator<V extends Vertex>

  • java.lang.Object
    • rioko.searchers.SearchIterator<V>
      • rioko.searchers.BreadthSearchIterator<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Class of the vertex of the graph.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectedSearchIterator, UndirectedSearchIterator

    public abstract class BreadthSearchIterator<V extends Vertex>
extends SearchIterator<V>
    Breadth search algorithm used in graphs of the class AbstractGraph<V,E>.
    Author:
    Antonio

      • isValidVertex

        protected boolean isValidVertex(V vertex)
        Method to know if a vertex is valid for the breadth algorithm
        Parameters:
        vertex - Vertex we want to check.
        Returns:
        True if the vertex should be add to the queue when the algorithm reach it and false otherwise.

      • isValidEdge

        protected abstract boolean isValidEdge(Edge<V> edge,
                                       V currentVertex)
        Abstract method to know if an edge is valid to explore in the breadth algorithm.
        Parameters:
        edge - Edge we want to check.
        currentVertex - Vertex where the algorithm is exploring currently.
        Returns:
        True if the edge should be explore in this step of the algorithm.
